title: 163: Machiavelli's "The Prince" or "How to kill friends and influence people."
dc:creator: A.J. Hanenburg
description: Machiavelli was a statesman that wanted back into the good graces of the Medici. It half worked. This is a discussion of the work that was supposed to do the job of charming the prince. It's entitled, shockingly, "The Prince."
itunes:author: Three guys who are hunkering down in town for the long siege.
itunes:subtitle: or "How to kill friends and influence people"
